Eligibility: - Histologically confirmed breast adenocarcinoma by routine hematoxyline and eosine (H&E) staining
Primary tumour 4 cm and 0-3 axillary lymph nodes positive (pathological T1-2, N0-N1, pathological M0)
Patients with positive lymph nodes only by cytokeratin staining (i.e., H&E negative) are eligible.
No squamous breast carcinoma or squamous sarcoma
Patients should have undergone segmental mastectomy (SM) with level I axillary dissection or sentinel lymph nodes biopsy in the last 14 weeks.
The surgical margins at the time of SM must be negative (> 3 mm) for both invasive carcinomas and non-invasive ductal carcinomas
Fertile patients should use effective non-hormonal contraception
No other malignancy in the last 5 years, except skin cancer or in situ carcinoma of the treated basal cell or squamous cell
No other serious or poorly controlled medical or psychiatric conditions that could be exacerbated by, or complicate compliance with study treatment
No previous radiation therapy in the breast
- Hormones administered for non-disease-related conditions (e.g. insulin for diabetes, synthroid for hypothyroidism)
Dexamethasone intermittently as antiemetic or premedication
